page.title: 07DAIRY FARMING AT TYWARDREATH
page.content: There are {fewer farms}in our area than there were twenty years ago. This is because land around Tywardreath has been sold for {building sites}and farms have also joined together. The biggest farms are about 200 acres but most farms are 100 acres or less. The smaller ones are usually{dairy farms.} Dairy farming plays a large part in the area. Channel Island cows used to be kept for their creamy milk but they only give 3 gallons daily. Nowadays people are health conscious and prefer less creamy milk so the farmers keep Friesians which might give 5 gallons a day. {Milking}takes place twice a day and the milk is stored in{refrigerated {tanks}and collected daily by {tanker,} taken to the{factory at Lostwithiel} and used for powdered milk.
